sen.j: 上国（じょうこく）とは律令国の等級区分のひとつ。
sen.e: Jokoku (second-biggest provinces next to Taikoku) is one of grade classifications of provinces governed in accordance with the Ritsuryo codes.
sen.cmt: 用語リストではjogoku（じょうごく）となっていますが、原文の読み方に合わせて、jokoku（じょうこく）としました。
sen.e: "Jokoku" (second-biggest provinces next to Taikoku) is one of grade classifications of provinces governed in accordance with the Ritsuryo codes.
sen.cmt: Jokoku にダブルコーテーションを追記しました。
sen.e: "Jokoku" (second-biggest provinces next to Taikoku) is one of grade classifications of provinces governed in accordance with the Ritsuryo codes.

sen.j: 中央集権的な統治制度である律令制が布かれた時代にほぼ定められた。
sen.e: Jokoku was almost established in the period when the ritsuryo system, which was centralized governing system, was put in place.
It was almost established in the period when the ritsuryo system, which was centralized governing system, was put in place.
sen.cmt: Jokoku を It に修正しました。
sen.e: It was almost established in the period when the ritsuryo system, which was centralized governing system, was put in place.

sen.j: 朝廷は中央集権体制を確立するために地方行政区画をおこない、政治力・経済力や土地面積・石高・人口などの国力により地方諸国を四等級に分けた。
sen.e: The Imperial Court decided local administration sections in order to establish centralized administrative framework and divided various provinces into four grades in accordance with political power, economic power and national power such as land area, kokudaka (crop yield), population.

The Imperial Court decided local administration sections in order to establish centralized administrative framework and divided various provinces into four grades in accordance with political power, economic power and national power such as land area, kokudaka (crop yield), population.

The Imperial Court decided local administration sections in order to establish centralized administrative framework and divided various provinces into four grades in accordance with political power, economic power and national power such as land area, kokudaka (crop yield), population.
Taikoku (ryoseikoku) (major provinces)
Taikoku (ryoseikoku) (major provinces)
Taikoku (ryoseikoku) (major provinces)
Jokoku (second-biggest provinces next to Taikoku)
Jokoku (second-biggest provinces next to Taikoku)
Jokoku (second-biggest provinces next to Taikoku)

sen.j: 中国 (令制国)（ちゅうごく）
sen.e: Chugoku (ryoseikoku) (middle-sized provinces)
Chugoku (ryoseikoku) (middle-sized provinces)
Chugoku (ryoseikoku) (middle-sized provinces)
Gekoku (minor provinces)
Gekoku (minor provinces)
Gekoku (minor provinces)

sen.j: 上国（じょうこく）は上から第二番目の位の国である。
sen.e: Jokoku was a second-biggest province.
Jokoku was a second-biggest province.
Jokoku was a second-biggest province.

sen.j: ただし、等級区分の基準はつまびらかではない。
sen.e: However, the standard of grade classifications was not clear.
However, the standard of grade classifications was not clear.
However, the standard of grade classifications was not clear.

sen.j: なお、国の等級区分の違いによって国司の官位等級にも差がつけられた。
sen.e: In addition, grades of official court rank for Kokushi (provincial governor) were differentiated in accordance with the differences in grade classifications of provinces.
In addition, grades of official court rank for Kokushi (provincial governor) were differentiated in accordance with the grade of provinces.
sen.cmt: differences in grade classifications を grade に修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, grades of official court rank for Kokushi (provincial governor) were differentiated in accordance with the grade of provinces.

sen.j: また、京からの遠近によって、遠国（おんごく）・中国（ちゅうごく）・近国（きんごく）にも分けている。
sen.e: Also, provinces were also classified into ongoku (far countries), chugoku (middle countries), kingoku (near countries) in accordance with the distance from Kyoto.
Also, provinces were classified into ongoku (far countries), chugoku (middle countries), kingoku (near countries) in accordance with the distance from Kyoto.
Also, provinces were classified into ongoku (far countries), chugoku (middle countries), kingoku (near countries) in accordance with the distance from Kyoto.
